book_name: Do the Work, Overcome Resistance and Get Out of Your Own Way by Steven Pressfield
summary: In this chapter, Steven Pressfield elaborates on the nature of Resistance, emphasizing that it is an internal adversary that desires to undermine our creative urges. The chapter presents two crucial tests that assess our commitment and motivation in the face of this formidable enemy. The first test evaluates how deeply we desire our creative pursuits, while the second seeks to understand the underlying reasons behind that desire. Pressfield insists that only genuine passions rooted in love or an intrinsic need can withstand the trials of Resistance, encouraging readers to confront their internal struggles and reaffirm their dedication to their work.

slides.section_body: Resistance is an unyielding force, intent on thwarting our creative ambitions. It is not a mere annoyance; it can be as lethal as a disease. Understanding this enemy’s relentless nature is crucial to overcoming it.
slides.quote: It will kill you. It will kill you like cancer.

slides.section_body: Unlike external adversaries, Resistance originates from within us. No escape from this inner foe is possible; even isolation cannot rid you of it.
While the voice of Resistance resides within, it does not define who you are. Acknowledge its presence without self-blame; a universal struggle faced by all creators.
slides.quote: The enemy is in you, but it is not you.

slides.section_body: Every individual must engage in a fight between their 'real self' and the 'Resistance self.' This battle is necessary for unlocking the wisdom and freedom that lies within us.
slides.quote: On the field of the Self stand a knight and a dragon.

slides.section_body: Resistance emerges after the impulse to create arises. This fear-driven reaction highlights the vitality of the creative urge, which fuels our artistic journey.
In our creative quests, we can rely on unseen forces or 'Assistance' that help guide us through the challenges of Resistance, allowing our visions to take flight.
slides.quote: The opposite of Resistance is Assistance.

slides.section_body: Resistance poses the question: 'How bad do you want it?' Your answer dictates your level of commitment to your creative pursuits.
slides.quote: Mark the selection that corresponds to how you feel.

slides.section_body: The next question asks 'Why do you want it?' The motives behind your desires reveal whether they are rooted in genuine passion or external validation.
slides.quote: If you checked 8 or 9, you get to stay on the island.

slides.section_title: CHECK INTO THE ATTITUDE ADJUSTMENT CHAMBER
slides.section_body: To navigate Resistance, leave behind any sense of entitlement, fear, or ego. Retain only your love for the work and the will to see it through.
slides.quote: Leave behind everything but love for the work.

slides.section_body: Experiencing failure is a universal aspect of the creative process. Crashes offer valuable insights and personal growth, pushing us beyond our limits.
slides.quote: Crashes are hell, but in the end, they’re good for us.
